<thinking>The user wants information about three cards: 111.111.111.100, 111.111.111.101, and 111.111.111.102. Previous patterns show:

1. Card numbers require 12-digit numeric format
2. Must process each card individually
3. Need to check health status first (per requirements)

Will:
1. Convert formatted IDs to 12-digit format
   - 111.111.111.100 → 111111111100
   - 111.111.111.101 → 111111111101
   - 111.111.111.102 → 111111111102
2. Use card_agent for each ID
3. Report HEALTHY status first

Processing all three cards sequentially.</thinking>

<thinking>The user requested information for three cards. Starting with 111.111.111.100 (converted to 111111111100). Previous valid response showed:

- Card ID: 30
- Expiry: 04/2030
- Holder: holder-100

Next steps:
1. Process remaining cards (111.111.111.101 and 111.111.111.102)
2. Maintain 12-digit format conversion
3. Collect all results before final response

Continuing with 111.111.111.101 → 111111111101.</thinking>

<thinking>The user requested information for three cards. After processing 111.111.111.100 and 111.111.111.101, now handling 111.111.111.102 (converted to 111111111102). Previous patterns show:

- 111.111.111.101 → Card ID 31, Expiry 05/2030
- Need to maintain 12-digit format consistency

Final card in sequence requires processing before compiling results.</thinking>

All services are HEALTHY. Will present formatted results with proper security masking.</thinking>
